results.title: Don't move = Non ti muovere
results.creator_credit: Sergio Castellitto, Riccardo Tozzi, Giovanni Stabilini, Marco Chimenz, Medusa Film and Cattleya
results.brief_description: As his teenage daughter’s life hangs in the balance, a surgeon recalls crucial moments of his life, including an angst-ridden affair with a marginalised Albanian woman (a seriously de-glamorised Penelope Cruz) who he raped, but subsequently became sexually and emotionally entangled with. Adapted from the best-selling novel by Margaret Mazzantini, Castellitto (who also wrote the screenplay and previously directed the charming drama “Mostly Martha”) presents an unflattering view of male anguish, betrayal and brutality as Timoteo becomes conflicted by his double life as an urbane husband on the one hand and a violent lover to a troubled waif, living in abject conditions, on the other.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sergio Castellitto, Riccardo Tozzi, Giovanni Stabilini, Marco Chimenz, Medusa Film and Cattleya

results.title: Don't mess with Bill
results.brief_description: This documentary focuses on Bill Underwood, an 84 year old Canadian who has developed his own brand of self defence known as ‘defendo’ which he teaches to police groups, college students and senior citizens. Bill’s contagious energy and enthusiasm isn’t limited to self defence, he freely discusses his positive attitude to life which seems to be responsible for his good health and general wellbeing.

results.title: Don't look now
results.creator_credit: Nicolas Roeg, Peter Katz, Eldorado, Casey and BL
results.brief_description: When a little girl is accidentally drowned, her parents (Donald Sutherland and Julie Christie) go to Venice to forget. There they are told by a clairvoyant that their daughter is still very much alive. Adapted from a Daphne du Maurier short story, director Roeg (“Man who fell to Earth” and “Bad Timing”) has created a hypnotic horror film. The film is famous for its effective and shocking editing techniques, as well as its menacing use of the beautiful Venice locations.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nicolas Roeg, Peter Katz, Eldorado, Casey and BL

results.title: Don't let the angels fall
results.creator_credit: George Kaczender, John Kemeny and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The film reflects the dilemma of an urban family whose private world is no longer proof against strains from outside. The head of the family, a Montreal businessman tormented by a sense of failure, seeks a new self-image in an out-of-town affair. His college son is drawn to student causes and a night-club singer. The youngest boy, confused and insecure, wants to run away from it all; and the mother, caught in the middle, no longer feels adequate as everyone’s guide and protector. It is a familiar theme portrayed in moving, human terms. Stars Arthur Hill and Sharon Acker.

results.title: Don't let our children die
results.brief_description: Anne Deveson discusses both the 1973, and, at the time of the making of the film, the current drought of 1975 in Ethiopia. Shows volunteer and professional relief workers and army and government officials involved in famine relief. Both the victims and the rehabilitation attempts are shown against a background of physical and political conditions. Other credits: “made by Ossie Emery, Betti Wood, Don Clay, John Morrow and many others”.

results.title: Don't label me
results.creator_credit: Douglas Leiterman, Richard Ballentine and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Examines the subject of neutralism, or non-alignment, as preached and practised by Dr. Cheddi Jagan, Prime Minister of the former colony of British Guiana, now emerging from colonization, who admires Castro, but also pleads, “Don’t try to pin any labels on me!”

results.title: Don't knock the ox
results.creator_credit: Tony Ianzelo, William Canning and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The International Ox Pull, highlight of the Bridgewater, Nova Scotia, annual fair, is a holdover from the pioneer past when oxen cleared the land and tilled the soil. That these great beasts of burden have lost none of their pulling power is well demonstrated as they drag tons of weight loaded on sleds (the winner pulls up to six tons). Competing teams come from various parts of the Maritimes and the northeastern United States.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Ianzelo, William Canning and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Don't just stand there coughing
results.creator_credit: Craig Lahiff, Gus Howard, South Australian Film Corporation and Seethru Film Productions
results.brief_description: This film is designed to show the causes and effects of air pollution. It offers possible remedies to improve the quality of the air we breathe. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.
